column2: . . . And so they came at last deep into the glen; and there stood a sheer wall of rock, and in the wall the Dark Door gaped before them like the mouth of night. Signs and figures were carved above its wide arch too dim to read, and fear flowed from it like a grey vapour. . . 'This is an evil door,' said [[Halbarad]], 'and my death lies beyond it. . .' It seemed to [Gimli] that he dragged his feet like lead over the threshold; and at once a blindness came upon him. . .
location=Beginning of the [[Paths of the Dead]], end of the [[Dimholt]], foot of [[Dwimorberg]]; beyond [[Dwimorberg glen]]
description=Hollow opening, carved into the cliff, with a standing stone in the centre

column1: The '''Dark Door''', also called the '''Gate of the Dead''',<ref>{{VT
column2: 42a}}, p. 22</ref> was the entrance to the [[Paths of the Dead]] beneath the [[White Mountains]]. Through this entrance in {{TA
column3: 2570}} [[Baldor]] son of [[Brego]] passed never to return.<ref>{{App
column6: n}} through the door [[Aragorn]] and his companions passed during the [[War of the Ring]] to stir the [[Oathbreakers
